fact: Did You Know That Ojaina is the place where the Attah's of Igala are burried?
Did You Know That the first aircraft landed at Idah in 1955?
Did You Know That Attah Ameh Oboni, had seen to the completion of an aerodrome in 1954 at Idah?
Did you know that the Igala alphabet was adopted from the English alphabet. The latter has five (5) vowels: “a,” “e,” “i,” “o,” “u.”?

quote: Did you know the Igala alphabet is made up of thirty-one (31) letters: some vowels, others consonants?

fact: Did You Know That Ojaina is a restricted place only allowed for members from the Attah Ruling House?

author: IgalaDigital
fact: Did you know that Ata Ameh Oboni speak fluently in Igala, Ebira & Hausa?

author: Onuche Joseph
fact: Did you know that the Ígálá language has seven (7) vowels: “a,” “e,” “ẹ,” “i,” “o,” “ọ,” “u” (encompassing both all the 5 English vowels and two indigenous ones, ‘ẹ’ and  ‘ọ’).?

author: Naomi
fact: Did You Know That Idah is also called Idah Alu Ogo Oja Abutu Eje?

author: Inikpi
fact: Did you know that the Igala kingdom was founded by Abutu- Eje in the 7th century
